verses.kjv: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.web: This is what Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This is the message that Isaiah son of Amoz received in a vision about Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the LORD’s house shall be established in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.
verses.web: It shall happen in the latter days, that the mountain of LORD’s house shall be established on the top of the mountains, and shall be raised above the hills; and all nations shall flow to it.
verses.ct: In the last days, the mountain where the LORD's temple stands will be established as the highest of all mountains, raised above every hill, and people from every nation will stream toward it.

verses.kjv: And many people shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
verses.web: Many peoples shall go and say, “Come, let’s go up to the mountain of LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths.” For the law shall go out of Zion, and LORD’s word from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Many peoples will say, "Come, let's go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob. He will teach us his ways, and we will follow his paths." For the law will go out from Zion, and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he shall judge among the nations, and shall rebuke many people: and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.
verses.web: He will judge between the nations, and will decide concerning many peoples. They shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.
verses.ct: He will settle disputes between nations and correct many peoples. They will hammer their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not raise a sword against nation, and they will never again train for war.

verses.kjv: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
verses.web: House of Jacob, come, and let’s walk in the light of LORD.
verses.ct: People of Jacob, come — let's walk in the light of the LORD!

verses.kjv: Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they be replenished from the east, and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.
verses.web: For you have forsaken your people, the house of Jacob, because they are filled from the east, with those who practice divination like the Philistines, and they clasp hands with the children of foreigners.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, have abandoned your people, the house of Jacob, because they have filled themselves with Eastern practices, they consult fortune-tellers like the Philistines, and they make alliances with foreigners.

verses.kjv: Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots:
verses.web: Their land is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures. Their land also is full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots.
verses.ct: Their land overflows with silver and gold — there's no end to their wealth. Their land is packed with horses — there's no end to their chariots.

verses.kjv: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:
verses.web: Their land also is full of idols. They worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made.
verses.ct: Their land is also packed with idols. They bow down to things their own hands have made, objects shaped by their own fingers.

verses.kjv: And the mean man boweth down, and the great man humbleth himself: therefore forgive them not.
verses.web: Man is brought low, and mankind is humbled; therefore don’t forgive them.
verses.ct: So the common person is brought low and the powerful are humbled — do not forgive them!

verses.kjv: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty.
verses.web: Enter into the rock, and hide in the dust, from before the terror of LORD, and from the glory of his majesty.
verses.ct: Hide among the rocks! Bury yourself in the dust! Run from the fear of the LORD and the glory of his majesty.

verses.kjv: The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.web: The lofty looks of man will be brought low, the arrogance of men will be bowed down, and LORD alone will be exalted in that day.
verses.ct: The proud looks of humanity will be brought low, and human arrogance will be crushed. The LORD alone will be exalted on that day.

verses.kjv: For the day of the LORD of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty, and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:
verses.web: For there will be a day of LORD of Armies for all that is proud and arrogant, and for all that is lifted up; and it shall be brought low:
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies has set aside a day to deal with everyone who is proud, arrogant, and self-important — and they will all be brought low.

verses.kjv: And upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,
verses.web: for all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, for all the oaks of Bashan,
verses.ct: That day will come against all the tall, towering cedars of Lebanon and all the mighty oaks of Bashan,

verses.kjv: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,
verses.web: for all the high mountains, for all the hills that are lifted up,
verses.ct: against every high mountain and every lofty hill,

verses.kjv: And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,
verses.web: for every lofty tower, for every fortified wall,
verses.ct: against every tall tower and every fortified wall,

verses.kjv: And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.
verses.web: for all the ships of Tarshish, and for all pleasant imagery.
verses.ct: against all the great trading ships of Tarshish and every beautiful vessel.

verses.kjv: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be made low: and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.web: The loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the arrogance of men shall be brought low; and LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
verses.ct: Human pride will be brought down, and human arrogance will be crushed. The LORD alone will be exalted on that day.

verses.kjv: And the idols he shall utterly abolish.
verses.web: The idols shall utterly pass away.
verses.ct: The idols will completely disappear.

verses.kjv: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
verses.web: Men shall go into the caves of the rocks, and into the holes of the earth, from before the terror of LORD, and from the glory of his majesty, when he arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.ct: People will crawl into caves in the rocks and holes in the ground, fleeing from the fear of the LORD and the glory of his majesty when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.kjv: In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they made each one for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats;
verses.web: In that day, men shall cast away their idols of silver and their idols of gold, which have been made for themselves to worship, to the moles and to the bats,
verses.ct: On that day, people will throw away the silver idols and gold idols they made for themselves to worship — they'll toss them to the moles and the bats.

verses.kjv: To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
verses.web: to go into the caverns of the rocks, and into the clefts of the ragged rocks, from before the terror of LORD, and from the glory of his majesty, when he arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.ct: They will scramble into the crevices of the rocks and the cracks of the jagged cliffs, fleeing from the fear of the LORD and the glory of his majesty when he rises to shake the earth.

verses.kjv: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be accounted of ?
verses.web: Stop trusting in man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for of what account is he?
verses.ct: Stop putting your trust in mere humans, who have nothing but breath in their nostrils. What are they really worth?
